synthesis_method: The electrolyte synthesis process involves weighing lithium sulfide, diphosphorus pentasulfide, lithium bromide, and iodine, mixing them with dehydrated chlorobenzene in a planetary ball mill for 40 hours to produce a sulfide-based solid electrolyte, then precipitating the product, drying under reduced pressure, and finally heating the amorphous solid electrolyte at 188°C for 3 hours to obtain a crystalline sulfide-based solid electrolyte.
